intro: Wahlenbergia melanops, commonly known as the blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, with a white or pale blue center, giving it the appearance of having "eyes." Wahlenbergia melanops is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
